column1: With that said, this hospital is a hit among the Lego community. With three floors, a helicopter, and ambulance, it gives you all you need in the typical hospital scene. The modern-style exterior is flashy and has excellent detailing, while the inside is playable and covers a wide range of medical departments. The minifigure count is high- 11 or 10.5 (the baby), and more than enough. I really enjoyed the new and updated medical personnel.

One thing that really caught my eye with this set- it has similar dimensions to the 4429 helicopter rescue set. This means that if you have the 4429 set, you can attach it to the side of the hospital via the ambulance bay. This creates a large and very impressive hospital complex.

The many minifigures are included in this set.
column2: Four nurses/doctors, ambulance driver, pilot, and four patients/citizens, and a baby.&nbsp
column3: Some include double sided faces which is a plus.

column1: Ambulance: This is a wonderful vehicle.
column2: It has room for one driver and someone lying in a stretcher in back.&nbsp
column3: Unfortunately it does not have room for dials or other life saving equipment or even another nurse.&nbsp

column1: Helicopter: Worst part of every Lego city set.
column3: The landing pad is not special, but is neat because most hospitals do have one either on the roof or off to the side.&nbsp

column1: Building: Built in a modular style, the floors are rearrangable, which is neat.
column2: On the first floor, the door slides open, and there is a gift shop of sorts with pastries, water, and Lego sets.&nbsp
column3: No money is included to pay for this though.&nbsp
column4: There is no check-in desk, which is apart of almost every real life hospital.&nbsp
column5: There is instead a computer check in.&nbsp
column6: To the left is an emergency entrance, which does not have a closing door.

column1: Second floor: includes an x-ray machine with a light brick.
column2: This function is ingenious, but because of the the type of light, it is somewhat hard to tell what the projection is showing.&nbsp
column3: Also on this floor is an eye doctor with an eye chart that reads &quot
column4: IF YOU CAN READ THIS YOU HAVE GOOD VISION&quot

column1: Third floor: hospital room with various monitors and so forth, and also a table of sorts for the newly born baby to sleep in.
column2: This also includes a balcony, which is only two studs deep and therefore not very usable.&nbsp
column3: An adjustable lamp hangs from the ceiling which is neat. The roof of the building is not spectacular in any way.

column1: Verdict:
column2: An excellent build, but seems a bit small compared to its contemporaries of the police station and fire station of one and two years prior respectively.&nbsp
column3: I personally followed the design of the building and with my own pieces extended the bottom floor to the right a little bit to add another room, which adds substance.&nbsp
column4: Other than that, an excellent build, but consider ordering pieces to enlarge it from bricklink or somewhere.
